title: SCP OCT Hub
content:
[[>]]
[[module Rate]]
[[/>]]
= [[size 300%]]**ROUND 4?!?!**[[/size]]
@@@@
@@@@
@@@@
= [[size 200%]] **[[*user keyii]]** vs **[[*user Weryllium]]**  vs **[[*user OthelloTheCat]]**[[/size]]

||~ [[[Anomalous Teens Against Trilobite Schemes]]] ||  ||~ [[[poky-ch-arms|Poky ChArms]]] || ||~ [[[una-comedia-romantica-protagonizada-por-un-mosquito|La Marcha GrenaDEETa]]] ||
||~ [[[Cafeteria Chat]]] || ||~ [[[armageddon|Arm-ageddon]]] || ||~ [[[an-action-movie-with-romantic-sub-plots-starring-a-mosquito|I am Become DEET, Destroyer of Worlds]]] ||
||~ [[[scp-oct-hub|Coming Soon!]]] || ||~ [[[scp-oct-hub|Coming Soon!]]] || ||~ [[[spock-the-rock-doc-ock-and-hulk-hogan|The Ultimate Showdown of Ultimate DEETstiny]]] ||

------

= [[size 200%]] **[[*user UraniumEmpire]]** vs **[[*user psul]]**  vs **[[*user Gabriel Jade]]**

||~ [[[scp-952|Veronica Fitzroy]]] || VS ||~ [[[scp-3512|Agent Tomàs Rey]]] || VS ||~ [[[scp-049|The Plague Doctor]]] ||
||~ [[[d-7294-s-declassified-d-class-survival-guide|D-7294's Declassified D-Class Survival Guide]]] || ||~ [[[tooth-and-claw|Ombres Malvants: 1) Tooth and Claw]]] || ||~ [[[Going Home]]] ||
||~ [[[the-last-things-dr-darryl-loyd-ever-did-in-chronological-ord|The Last Things Dr. Darryl Loyd Ever Did, in Chronological Order]]] ||  ||~ [[[blue-pills|2) blue pills]]] ||  ||~ [[[Los Dias Y Los Caballeros De Leslie Y El Doctor]]] ||
||~ [[[baptism-of-the-wandering-jew-by-johnny-the-son|Baptism of the Wandering Jew by Johnny the Son]]] || ||~ [[[green-recruit|3) Green Recruit]]] || ||~ [[[Foundation Facilities, and How to Loot Them]]] ||
||~ [[[scp-oct-hub|Coming Soon!]]] || ||~ [[[Blackout|Ombres Malvants: 4) Blackout]]]  || ||~ [[[scp-oct-hub|Coming Soon!]]] ||

= **Posting deadline:** April 5th at 11:59 PM 
= **Voting deadline:** April 26th at 11:59 PM **OR** exactly 3 weeks after the last person posts.[[footnote]]Whichever happens first. Also, contestants are welcome to understandably say "it's been two years, screw this" and drop out.[[/footnote]]
= As always, you can still post during the voting period, but you'll have less time to accumulate votes.

= What about the people who already posted their Round 4 entries, you ask? Well, only votes from the first three weeks after the article was posted will be counted. Thanks, scpper!


[[/size]]
@@@@
@@@@
[[image OCTBracket4.png]]
@@@@
@@@@
@@@@

@@@@
@@@@
@@@@
[[collapsible show="+ What is this?" hide="- Hide explanation"]]
[[div class="body-text"]]
It's some REALLY STINKING OLD thing Peppers did once. It ended very abruptly and then started back up again even more abruptly a year and a half later.

**How it works:** Every contestant enters with a character of their own creation. Each round, you are paired against another contestant, and you must write a brand new tale involving both your character and your opponent's. 

The two characters can fight against each other, fight side-by-side, go on an adventure together, hang out at a bar, or whatever else you want them to do. Whoever gets the most upvotes on their tale moves on to the next round. Your next tale must pick up where your last round's entry left off.
[[/div]]
[[/collapsible]]
@@@@
[[collapsible show="+ What are the rules?" hide="- Hide rules."]]
[[div class="body-text"]]
**Notes on posting:** 
* Please include a link to your opponent’s entry at the bottom of your own entry. It’s good form. 
* If you default[[footnote]]i.e. fail to post any entry at all, no matter how short[[/footnote]], you will be barred from entering the next OCT[[footnote]]Assuming there is one.[[/footnote]]. You’ll be welcome to try again in OCT 3.
* If your entry is deleted, you may post another. This process may continue until the voting period ends.
* In the event that both authors in a matchup default or neither author can post a successful entry, both authors will be disqualified. The author who would have faced the winner from this matchup will be instead assigned to a three-way match with two other competitors.  

**Tips:**
* Keep things relatively simple in the beginning. Since every round’s entries continue your story from the previous round, entries tend to get longer and more complicated as the competition progresses. 
* You’ve been given a lot of freedom in this OCT—be sure to use it! Don’t feel limited to traditional structures and settings. 
* Time management is key! Don't forget to budget time to read your opponent's material.

**More rules:**
* You may use existing characters (including SCPs!) as long as **you** created them. New characters are fine, too.
* All your entries[[footnote]]Not including auditions.[[/footnote]] must tell one continuous story. Your Round 2 entry should pick up after the events of your Round 1, and so on. However, your entries are not required to follow the continuity of other contestants' entries. 
* Your character can be human, animal, vegetable, mineral, or anything else you can imagine. Just make sure the character is interesting.
* The opponent's character should be featured heavily in your entry. You can't just write a tale that's 99% about your character alone.
* There will be 16 contenders, which means four competition rounds. In the event of a large response, this will be expanded to 32 contenders and 5 rounds.
* You may assign a back-up character to use in the event your preferred choice doesn't get in.
* Brackets will be decided via [[[https://www.researchgate.net/publication/248422647_What_is_the_Correct_Way_to_Seed_a_Knockout_Tournament|cohort randomized seeding]]] based on scores from the audition entries as well as author stats. [[[https://kaktuskontainer.wdfiles.com/local--files/super-secret/TournamentSeeding.jpg|(Diagram here.)]]]
[[/div]]
[[/collapsible]]
@@@@
@@@@

[[size 300%]]**BONUS ROUND**[[/size]]

The following contestants did not clear the list to make the main bracket, but because we had //way// more entrants than expected, there’s enough for a side-tournament! Contestants will compete in 2 rounds in groups of 3. The winner will join the main tournament in Round 3. 

Everything essentially works the same, but you’ll need to fit //two// opponents’ characters into your entry. Good luck!

[[=]]
[[size 300%]]**BONUS ROUND**[[/size]]
[[/=]]
The following contestants did not clear the list to make the main bracket, but because we had //way// more entrants than expected, there’s enough for a side-tournament! Contestants will compete in 2 rounds in groups of 3. The winner will join the main tournament in Round 3. 

Everything essentially works the same, but you’ll need to fit //two// opponents’ characters into your entry. Good luck!

[!-- CSS shortcut --]
[[include :scp-wiki:theme:oct]]

[[module CSS]]
.body-text {
    margin: 2% 13% 2% 9%;
    padding: 5px 20px 5px 20px;
    background-color: #f2f2f2;
    color: #111;
}

.text4desk {
    width: 70%;
    margin: auto;
    text-align: center;
}

#page-content .collapsible-block {  
  max-width: 100%;
    /* text-align: center; */
    text-align: center;
    text-color: black;
    border-color: #fff;
    border: solid 1px #fff;
}
#page-content .collapsible-block-folded { 
    background-color: #f2f2f2;
}

#page-content .collapsible-block-unfolded { 
    text-align: center;
    margin: auto;
}

#page-content .collapsible-block-link {  
    font-size: 1.5em;
    font-weight: 900;
}

.collapsible-block-content p {
    text-align: left;
    padding-left: 5px;
    padding-right: 5px;
}

@media only screen and (max-width: 600px) {

    .body-text {
        margin: 0% 4% 0% 4%;
    }

    .text4desk {
        width:100%;
    }

}


[[/module]]
author: PeppersGhost
